My class inherits from a generic TestCase class that
we use for our project. I tried recreating the bug
with a stipped down version but couldn't, so I thought
it has something to do with our generic test class.

HOWEVER, when I changed my class to extend
junit.framework.test instead of our generic test
class, I still get the same error.

I'm puzzled right now.


--- "Demyanovich, Craig - Apogent"
<cdemyanovich@...> wrote:
> eyl2k,
> 
> I'm using JUnit 3.8.1, and I have a few TestCases
> with many more than six
> testXXX() methods.  Can you offer any more
> information about your
> environment?
> 
> Craig
> 
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: eyl2k [mailto:eyl2k@...] 
> > Sent: Friday, November 01, 2002 4:56 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] JUnit 3.8.1: Maximum number of
> testXXX() methods
> > 
> > 
> > MyTestCase with 5 testXXX() methods runs as
> expected. When I 
> > added a sixth testXXX() method, I get the
> following error message:
> >     [java] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
> > sun/reflect/ConstructorAccessorImpl
> > 
> > When I comment out one of the original testXXX()
> methods, 
> > everything runs as expected, so the 6th testXXX()
> method I 
> > added is fine.
> > 
> > I checked the FAQ but couldn't find this issue
> discussed.
> > 
> > Thanks for any information.
